thread.title: GM, McDonald’s, Amazon.com earnings in focus
thread.title_full: GM, McDonald’s, Amazon.com earnings in focus

title: GM, McDonald’s, Amazon.com earnings in focus
text:
Bloomberg GM is among the large caps reporting quarterly results on Thursday. 
Among the companies whose shares are expected to see active trade in Thursday’s session are General Motors Co., McDonald’s Corp., and Amazon.com Inc. 
General Motors GM, -0.30% is projected to post second-quarter earnings of $1.08 a share, according to a consensus survey by FactSet. The automobile maker earned 58 cents a share a year earlier. 
McDonald’s MCD, +0.27% is forecast to post second-quarter earnings of $1.23 a share, down from $1.40 a share a year ago. 
Comcast Corp. CMCSA, +0.36% is projected to report second-quarter earnings of 84 cents a share, according to a consensus survey by FactSet. The entertainment giant earned 75 cents a share a year ago. 
Nasdaq OMX Group Inc . NDAQ, +1.02% is projected to report second-quarter earnings of 80 cents a share, up from 70 cents a share a year earlier. 
Caterpillar Inc. CAT, -2.99% is likely to post second-quarter earnings of $1.27 a share, down from $1.69 a share a year earlier. 
Southwest Airlines Co. LUV, +1.18% is expected to report second-quarter earnings of $1.02 a share, up from 70 cents a share a year ago. 
After Thursday’s close of trading, Amazon.com AMZN, +0.06% is expected to post a loss of 15 cents a share, narrowing from a loss of 27 cents a share a year ago. 
AT&T Inc. T, -0.87% is likely to report second-quarter earnings of 63 cents a share, edging up from 62 cents a share a year earlier. 
Starbucks Corp. SBUX, +0.87% is forecast to post earnings of 41 cents a share in the fiscal third quarter, up from 34 cents a share a year earlier. 
Visa Inc. V, -0.07% is forecast to report fiscal third-quarter earnings of 58 cents a share, up from 54 cents a share a year ago. 
Pandora Media Inc. P, -1.21% is projected to report second-quarter earnings of 2 cents a share, down from 4 cents a share a year ago. 
After Wednesday’s closing bell, Qualcomm Corp. QCOM, -1.46% said it is planning to reduce spending by $1.4 billion and cut 15% of its workforce . The chip-making giant made its statements as it reported its fiscal third-quarter results. Qualcomm, which has been the target of activist investor Jana Partners LLC, said it would consider changes to its corporate structure that could include splitting up some of its businesses. 
American Express Co. AXP, +0.05% reported its second-quarter earnings fell to $1.47 billion, or $1.42 a share, from $1.53 billion, or $1.43 a share, a year earlier. Revenue decreased 4% to $8.28 billion. Analysts polled by Thomson Reuters projected the financial company to earn $1.32 a share and revenue of $8.46 billion. 
Las Vegas Sands Corp. LVS, +0.24% said its second-quarter earnings dropped to $469.2 million, or 59 cents a share, from $671.4 million, or 83 cents a share, a year earlier. Excluding items, the casino operator would have earned 60 cents a share. Revenue fell 19% to $3.09 billion. Analysts surveyed by Thomson Reuters had forecast per-share earnings of 60 cents and revenue of $2.99 billion. More from MarketWatch
